mathlib3D
Class Vertex3D

java.lang.Object
  mathlib3D.Vertex3D
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
public class Vertex3D
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable

Defines a 3D polygon vertex. Every polygon vertex contains a Point3D object representing the geometric location of the vertex in 3D space. Every Vertex3D also contains a Vector3D object representing the "vertex normal", a Color object representing the vertex color, and doubles representing the vertex "2D texture coordinates" (U,V,Q) and "3D texture coordinates" (I,J,K). These additional components are used in various shading algorithms.

Version:
4.10 02/18/05
Author:
John Clevenger
See Also:

Constructor Detail

Vertex3D

public Vertex3D()
Creates a new Vertex3D with default values. The default location is (0,0,0), with a homogeneous component W=1. The default values for the vertex normal are those specified by the no-argument constructor for class Vector3D. The default color is black (0,0,0). The default U,V,Q 2D texture coordinate values are (0,0,1); the default I,J,K 3D texture coordinate values are (0,0,0).

Vertex3D

public Vertex3D(double X,
                double Y,
                double Z)
Creates a new Vertex3D with the specified X,Y,Z location coordinates and default W, vertex normal, color, and texture coordinate values.

Vertex3D

public Vertex3D(double X,
                double Y,
                double Z,
                double W)
Creates a new Vertex3D with the specified X,Y,Z, and W location coordinates and default normal, color, and texture coordinate values.

Vertex3D

public Vertex3D(Point3D p)
Creates a new Vertex3D with the X,Y,Z, and W values specified by the given Point3D. The given Point3D object is not changed. The new Vertex3D contains default normal, color, and texture coordinate values.

Method Detail

getLocation

public Point3D getLocation()
Returns a new Point3D object whose location is the same as the location of this Vertex3D. That is, the X,Y,Z,W components of the returned point are the same as the X,Y,Z,W components of the location of this Vertex3D object. Note that what is returned is a new Point3D object, not a reference to the Point3D object contained in this Vertex3D.

setLocation

public void setLocation(Point3D thePoint)
Sets the location of this Vertex3D object to be the same as the location of the specified Point3D. That is, the X,Y,Z,W components of the location of this Vertex3D are set to be the same as the X,Y,Z,W values contained in the specified Point3D object. Note that this method does not store a reference to the specified Point3D object; it copies the X,Y,Z,W values from the Point3D object into the Vertex3D location.

setLocation

public void setLocation(double newX,
                        double newY,
                        double newZ,
                        double newW)
Sets the location of this Vertex3D object to the specified values.

setLocation

public void setLocation(double newX,
                        double newY,
                        double newZ)
Sets the X,Y,Z components of the location of this Vertex3D object to the specified values. The W value is set to 1.0.

getNormal

public Vector3D getNormal()
Returns a new Vector3D object whose magnitude and direction are the same as the vertex normal of this vertex. The W value in the returned Vector3D is set to 0.0.

getNormalX

public double getNormalX()
Returns the current value of the X component of the vertex normal.

getNormalY

public double getNormalY()
Returns the current value of the Y component of the vertex normal.

getNormalZ

Returns the current value of the Z component of the vertex normal.

Sets the vertex normal of this Vertex3D to a new Vector3D object which is a clone of the specified Vector3D object.

clone

public java.lang.Object clone()
Returns a new Object which is a deep clone of this Vertex3D.

Overrides:
clone in class java.lang.Object

minus

public Point3D minus(Vertex3D v2)
Returns a new Point3D whose X,Y,Z values are the difference between this vertex's X,Y,Z location values and the specified vertex's X,Y,Z location values. The new Point3D's W value is the default W value specified by the no-argument constructor of class Point3D.

distanceTo

public double distanceTo(Vertex3D v2)
Returns a real number that is the distance between this vertex's location and the specified vertex's location.

add

public Point3D add(Vertex3D v2)
Returns a new Point3D whose X,Y,Z values are the sum of this vertex's location values and the specified vertex's location values. The new Point3D's W value is the default W value specified by the no-argument constructor of class Point3D.

mid

public Point3D mid(Vertex3D v2)
Returns a new Point3D which is the midpoint between this vertex's location and the specified vertex's location. The new Point3D's W value is the default W value specified by the no-argument constructor of class Point3D.

mult

public Point3D mult(double theMultiplier)
Returns a new Point3D which is the result of multiplying this vertex's X,Y,Z location values by the given multiplier. The new Point3D's W value is the default W value specified by the no-argument constructor of class Point3D.

div

public Point3D div(double theDivisor)
Returns a new Point3D which is the result of dividing this vertex's X,Y,Z location values by the given divisor. The new Point3D's W value is the default W value specified by the no-argument constructor of class Point3D.

mult

public Vertex3D mult(Matrix3D mat)
Returns a new Vertex3D object which is a clone of this vertex but with a Point3D location generated by multiplying this vertex's location by the specified Matrix3D. Multiplication is done in the order specified by the method Point3D.mult(Matrix3D).

scale

public void scale(double scaleFactor)
Scales each of the X, Y, and Z components of this vertex's location by the given scaleFactor. Note that this method does NOT return a new Point3D; it scales THIS vertex's X,Y,Z location values. The W value in the vertex location is unchanged.

dot

public double dot(Vertex3D v)
Returns the value of the "dot product" of the vector implied by this vertex's X,Y,Z with the vector implied by the specified vertex's X,Y,Z. Note that the dot product of two vectors is by definition a scalar value; this method returns that scalar as a double. Only the X, Y, and Z values of the vertex are used in computing the returned value; the W component is ignored.

cross

public Vector3D cross(Vertex3D aVertex)
Returns a Vector3D which represents the vector formed by taking the cross product of the vector implied by this vertex's X,Y,Z location with the vector implied by the specified vertex's X,Y,Z location.

cross

public Vector3D cross(Vector3D aVector)
Returns a Vector3D which represents the vector formed by taking the cross product of the vector implied by this vertex's X,Y,Z location with the specified vector.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a printable representation of this Vertex3D.

Overrides:
